heading: swift getaway
subheading: two armed men made off with an irreplaceable copy of jonathan swift's 1726 classic gulliver's travels on tuesday from a public library in armagh, northern ireland. police have not yet identified the two men, who brandished a handgun and then tied up a female librarian before stealing the rare copy in a daring daylight robbery. but if the robbers need to assuage their guilt, they need only crack open the stolen text and read from chapter six. swift himself understood that "... of necessity vast numbers of our people are compelled to seek their livelihood by begging, robbing, stealing, cheating, pimping, forswearing, flattering, suborning, forging, gaming, lying, fawning, hectoring, voting, scribbling, star-gazing, poisoning, whoring, canting, libeling, free thinking, and the like occupations."
author: wired staff
text: two armed men made off with an irreplaceable copy of jonathan swift's 1726 classic  gulliver's travels on tuesday from a public library in armagh, northern ireland. police have not yet identified the two men, who brandished a handgun and then tied up a female librarian before stealing the rare copy in a daring daylight robbery. but if the robbers need to assuage their guilt, they need only crack open the stolen text and read from chapter six. swift himself understood that "... of necessity vast numbers of our people are compelled to seek their livelihood by begging, robbing, stealing, cheating, pimping, forswearing, flattering, suborning, forging, gaming, lying, fawning, hectoring, voting, scribbling, star-gazing, poisoning, whoring, canting, libeling, free thinking, and the like occupations."
